newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-JUVENTUS COACH LIPPI VOTED ITALY'S BEST.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-JUVENTUS COACH LIPPI VOTED ITALY'S BEST.

text.p: Marcello Lippi, who steered Juventus to the European Cup in May, was voted the best coach in Italy for the second year running on Monday.
Coaches from serie A and serie B teams gathered at a conference at the Italian federation's training ground near Florence to vote for the best coach of 1995-96.

Lippi said afterwards that he had invited former Juventus players -- such as strikers Gianluca Vialli and Fabrizio Ravanelli who are now playing in England -- to accompany the club to Japan for next month's intercontinental cup.
"I know they won't be able to come but ideally I would like them to be with us," the coach said.
